name: crump
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a loud, heavy sound like something heavy or made of metal hitting a hard surface, especially a sound made by an explosion: The brutal crump of an explosion rattled the windows. There was the crump of the metal door slamming. Bombs or missiles hit nearby targets with loud crumps.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was terrified by the throbbing of the engines of the bombers overhead and the crump of bombs.There was never a day without air raid alerts or the distant "crump" of explosions.He saw flashes and smoke on the airstrip about half a mile away, followed by noisy crumps.Before parking sensors, the time-honoured method of parking was easing the car gently backwards until you heard a crump.

to make a loud, heavy sound like something heavy or made of metal hitting a hard surface: Mortars crumped, and from the east came the shriek of 88-millimeter shells. Their heavy boots crump on the ground.
More examplesFewer examplesShe heard his body crump onto the floor behind her. We heard deep, crumping noises like exploding shells.
